PositionSchedule.Name: Regular - Guaranteed minimum 40 hours per week

MatchedObjectDescriptor.QualificationSummary: Who May Apply: Open to everyone. Applicants will be categorized by preference(s) and/or priority consideration eligibilities. An applicant's eligibility will be determined based on eligibility claimed in the questionnaire and proof of eligibility MUST be provided with application by the closing date, 11/08/2021 Business Based Action, Military Spouse Preference, Outside Applicant Veteran, Spouse/Widow/Parent of Veteran, and Transition Hiring Preference In order to qualify, you must meet the experience requirements described below. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student; social). You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Your resume must clearly describe your relevant experience; if the position allows for qualifying based on education, your transcripts will be required as part of your application. Qualifying Experience: Must be able to follow simple oral instructions, be able to use hand tools for cleaning, and operate simple machines. Must be skilled in doing tasks with several steps and must use judgement in sequencing tasks. Must have knowledge of sanitation standards in handling and serving food, and for cleaning equipment and work area. Must be able to obtain a Food Handler's Certificate and/or complete food handler's training.

Details.JobSummary:
About the position:
This position will be assigned to the Mitchell Hall, Air Force Academy, Colorado This position does include benefits. Frequently lifts or moves objects weighing up to 40 pounds. Continuous standing, walking, frequent stooping, reaching, pushing, pulling and bending. May be required to work on ladders and use powered cleaning equipment.
Details.AgencyMarketingStatement: Thank you for considering employment with Air Force Services Non-Appropriated Funds (NAF)
MajorDuties: Sets up cafeteria lines, steam tables, dining room tables, and side service stands with hot and cold food items including meats, vegetables, salads, desserts, bread, butter and beverages. Serves food in a family style or cafeteria style. Breaks down and cleans area when meals are complete. Sets up dining room tables for service, to include banquet style set-up, places food and beverages on tables, and replenishes items as necessary. Sets up and operates dishwashers, performs preventive maintenance and cleaning. Scrapes, soaks, scours and scrubs bowls, pots and pans. Also performs heavy duty cleaning tasks such as ceilings, exhaust hoods, under and behind kitchen equipment, washes floors and walls, walk-in refrigerators and freezers, sanitizes garbage cans. May unload food from delivery trucks. Collects and transfers trash from work area to disposal area. Assembles and tosses fresh fruit or green salads in quantity using prepared dressings, serves into standard serving sizes. Makes cold sandwiches using prepared ingredients. Makes coffee, tea and other beverages. Performs other related duties as assigned. If interested in applying for this position you may preview the online application: https://apply.usastaffing.gov/ViewQuestionnaire/11077437
Details.Education: Some federal jobs allow you to substitute your education for the required experience in order to qualify. This position does not allow for education substitution. FOREIGN EDUCATION: Education completed in foreign colleges or universities may be used to meet the requirements. You must show proof the education credentials have been deemed to be at least equivalent to that gained in conventional U.S. education program. It is your responsibility to provide such evidence when applying.
Details.Evaluations: Your resume and supporting document will be evaluated against the qualifications of the position. Once the announcement has closed, a review of your application package (resume, supporting documents, and responses to the questionnaire) will be used to determine whether you meet the qualification requirements listed on this announcement. If you are minimally qualified, your resume and supporting documentation will be compared against your responses to the assessment questionnaire to determine your level of experience. If, after reviewing your resume and/or supporting documentation, a determination has been made that you have inflated your responses to meet the position's qualifications and/or experience, you may lose consideration for this position. Please follow all instructions carefully when applying, errors or omissions may affect your eligibility. You should list any relevant performance appraisals and incentive awards in your resume as that information may be taken into consideration during the selection process. If selected, you may be required to provide supporting documentation. To better expedite the hiring process, we recommend including full contact information (name, address, phone number, email, etc.,) for professional and personal references on your resume.
Details.HowToApply: To be considered for this vacancy you must apply and complete the online questionnaire and submit the documentation specified in the Required Documents section above. The complete application package must be submitted by 11:59 PM (EST) on 11/08/2021 to receive consideration. To begin, click Apply to access the online application. You will need to be logged into your USAJobs account to apply. If you do not have a USAJobs account, you will need to create one before beginning the application. Follow the prompts to select your resume and/or other supporting documents to be included with your application package. You will have the opportunity to upload additional documents to include in your application before it is submitted. Your uploaded documents may take several hours to clear the virus scan process. After acknowledging you have reviewed your application package, complete the Include Personal Information section as you deem appropriate and click to continue with the application process. You will be taken to the online application which you must complete in order to apply for the position. Complete the online application, verify the required documentation is included with your application package and submit the application. You must re-select your resume and/or other documents from your USAJobs account and designate the document type when submitting your application. Failure to complete this portion will result in an incomplete application package and you will not be further considered for this vacancy. It is your responsibility to ensure your application package (resume, supporting documents, and responses to the questionnaire) is complete, accurate, and submitted by the closing date. Additional information on how to complete the online application process and submit your online application may be found on the https://help.usastaffing.gov/Apply/index.php?title=Applicant To verify or check the status of your application, log into your USAJobs account. Once logged in, the Welcome screen lists your applications, your application status and the date it was last updated. For information on what each Application Status means, visit: https://www.usajobs.gov/Help/how-to/application/status If you are unable to apply online, view the following link for information regarding Alternate Application Information (https://help.usastaffing.gov/apply/index.php?title=Alternate_Application_Information)
Details.WhatToExpectNext: If you provided an email address, you will receive an email message acknowledging receipt of your application. Times may vary during the hiring process, as your application status updates/changes you will be notified with a notification letter via email.
Details.RequiredDocuments:
Required documents may vary based on the eligibility you are claiming (i.e., applying as a Military Spouse Preference - MSP, applying as a veteran, applying as a current federal employees, applying as a displaced employee, etc.,). The below document(s) are required and MUST be submitted with your application by the closing date of this job announcement: Resume Your resume may be submitted in any format and must support identified the general or specialized experience described in this announcement.
If your resume includes a photograph or other inappropriate material or content, it will not be used to make eligibility and qualification determinations and you may not be considered for this vacancy. Other accepted documents to support a qualification and/or claimed preference/priority eligibility may include: Cover LetterDD-214/ Statement of ServiceDiploma/ GEDDisability Letter (VA)LicenseOther (1)Other (2)PCS OrdersProfessional CertificationProof of Marriage StatusResumeSeparation Notice (RIF)SF-50/ Notification of Personnel ActionTranscript As described above, your complete application includes your resume, your responses to the online questionnaire, and supporting documents which prove your claimed eligibility. If you fail to provide these documents, you will be marked as having an incomplete application package and you will not be considered any further. NOTE: Documents submitted as part of the application package to include supplemental documents may be shared beyond the Human Resources Office. Some supplemental documents such as military orders and marriage certificates may contain personal information for someone other than you. You may sanitize these documents to remove another person's personal information before you submit your application. You may be asked to provide an un-sanitized version of the documents if you are selected to confirm your eligibility.
Details.OtherInformation: Individual must fully meet qualification/eligibility/background requirements for this position Male applicants born after December 31, 1959 must be registered for Selective Service Direct deposit is required Satisfactorily complete an employment verification (E-Verify) check A probationary period may be required Pre-employment requirements must be satisfactorily met prior to Entrance on Duty (EOD) Payment of Permanent Change of Station (PCS) costs is not authorized, based on a determination that a PCS move is not in the Government's interest. Multiple positions may be filled from this job opportunity announcement. And additional selections may also be made from this job opportunity announcement. Selection(s) are subject to restrictions resulting from hiring preferences and priority consideration eligible.

An applicant's eligibility will be determined based on eligibility claimed in the questionnaire and proof of eligibility MUST be provided with application by the closing date, 10/29/2021 Business Based Action, Military Spouse Preference, Outside Applicant Veteran, Spouse/Widow/Parent of Veteran, and Transition Hiring Preference In order to qualify, you must meet the experience requirements described below. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student; social). You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Your resume must clearly describe your relevant experience; if the position allows for qualifying based on education, your transcripts will be required as part of your application. Qualifying Experience: Must have experience in and knowledge of methods and procedures relating to food preparation and presentation gained in a grill, snack bar, restaurant, club or similar food activity. Ability to follow oral and written instructions, work safely, and do simple arithmetic. Knowledge of operating and cleaning food service equipment, characteristics of various foods, and the ability to season food and decide when foods are done is required. Must be physically able to frequently lift objects weighing up to 40 pounds. Must be able to continuously stand, walk, stoop, reach, push, pull and bend for long periods of time. Must be able to obtain a Food Handler's Certificate and/or complete food handler's training.

Details.JobSummary:
About the position:
This position will be assigned to the Eisenhower Golf Course, Air Force Academy, Colorado. This position does not include benefits. Continual standing and walking, and frequent stooping, reaching, pushing, pulling, and bending. Frequently lifts or moves objects weighing up to 40 pounds unassisted. Occasionally lifts or moves objects weighing over 40 pounds with assistance. Position subject to furlough from approximately 1 November to 1 April each year.
Details.AgencyMarketingStatement: Thank you for considering employment with Air Force Services Non-Appropriated Funds (NAF)
MajorDuties: Performs a full range of simple cooking tasks by preparing and cooking items that require little or no processing such as pancakes, sausage, eggs, hamburgers and fresh or canned vegetables. Prepares hot cereals, broiled meats; prepares and cooks concentrated or dehydrated soups, sauces, and gravies; makes cold sandwich fillings. Prepares convenience items such as frozen hash browns, fish fillets and chicken nuggets. Some cooks at this level prepare and bake pizza. Prepares food by peeling, chopping, grinding, paring, cutting, slicing, dicing, pureeing, dredging, flouring or breading; weighs, measures and assembles ingredients for regular menu items; sets up and replenishes salad bar; portions foods for distribution and meal service, and covers, dates and stores leftovers according to established procedures. Washes and cleans kitchen equipment. Performs other related duties as assigned. If interested in applying for this position you may preview the online application: https://apply.usastaffing.gov/ViewQuestionnaire/11180600

An applicant's eligibility will be determined based on eligibility claimed in the questionnaire and proof of eligibility MUST be provided with application by the closing date, 10/29/2021 Business Based Action, Military Spouse Preference, Outside Applicant Veteran, Spouse/Widow/Parent of Veteran, and Transition Hiring Preference In order to qualify, you must meet the experience requirements described below. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student; social). You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Your resume must clearly describe your relevant experience; if the position allows for qualifying based on education, your transcripts will be required as part of your application. Qualifying Experience: Experience in responsible clerical or office work which includes demonstrated ability to perform common arithmetic problems, and making change when receiving payments from customers. Experience selling alcoholic beverages and food and beverage experience preferred. Must be 21 years of age. Must be able to recognize intoxicated or unruly patrons and to resolve the problem or seek assistance if needed. Must be able to follow simple oral instructions. Must be physically able to frequently lift objects weighing 25 pounds, and occasionally lifting up to and over 40 pounds. Must be able to obtain a Food Handler's Certificate and/or complete food handler's training. Must be able to communicate orally and in writing. Must possess skill in dealing with the public. Must have the ability to operate a motor vehicle in a safe manner.

Details.JobSummary:
About the position:
This position will be assigned to the Eisenhower Golf Course, Air Force Academy, Colorado. This position does not include benefits. Subject to an uncommon tour of duty. Position is subject to furlough from approximately 1 November to 31 March of each year due to business slowdown caused by weather.
Details.AgencyMarketingStatement: Thank you for considering employment with Air Force Services Non-Appropriated Funds (NAF)
MajorDuties: Ike's Grill Duties: Sells a limited variety of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages, food items, prepackaged snacks and candy. Operates cash register, rings up the sale, receives money and makes change and processes credit card sales. At the end of each tour of duty, clears the cash register, and turns over cash and supporting documents as instructed. Maintains area in clean and orderly condition. May perform related food service duties such restocking beverage fridges, cleaning dining room tables, cleaning and restocking condiment station, taking out trash, vacuuming and mopping dining room, assisting at catered events and working in the Falcon's Nest Bar when assigned. Dog House Duties: Golf Course Half Way House Sells alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages, hot dogs, corn dogs, pretzel dogs and snacks. Serves patrons directly, receives payment, and makes and returns change to patrons. Loads up carry-all golf cart with supplies for the day and obtains cash bank. Stocks cart with buckets of ice, soda, beer, snacks, hot dogs, etc., and transports to the Dog House. Performs inventory of Dog House products at the beginning and end of each shift. Prepares documentation for cash funds accountability. Cleans and washes carry-all golf cart and removes all trash daily. Keeps building and surrounding area clean at all times. Performs other duties as assigned. If interested in applying for this position you may preview the online application: https://apply.usastaffing.gov/ViewQuestionnaire/11180895

An applicant's eligibility will be determined based on eligibility claimed in the questionnaire and proof of eligibility MUST be provided with application by the closing date, 11/18/2021 Business Based Action, Military Spouse Preference, Outside Applicant Veteran, Spouse/Widow/Parent of Veteran, and Transition Hiring Preference In order to qualify, you must meet the experience requirements described below. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student; social). You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Your resume must clearly describe your relevant experience; if the position allows for qualifying based on education, your transcripts will be required as part of your application. Qualifying Experience: Applicant must be currently enrolled in a Professional Golf Management (PGM) program at a PGM University or enrolled in the PGA/LPGA Apprentice Program. Position is seasonal May through October. This position requires the incumbent to satisfactory complete the applicable background investigations.

Details.JobSummary:
About the position:
This position will be assigned to the Eisenhower Golf Course, Air Force Academy, Colorado. This position does not include benefits. Applicant is required to lift objects weighing up to 25 pounds
Details.AgencyMarketingStatement: Thank you for considering employment with Air Force Services Non-Appropriated Funds (NAF)
MajorDuties: Assists the Operations Manager with the supervision of the Pro Shop Sales operation and outside golf support operations (i.e. club storage, cart operation, starter/monitors, and driving range operation). Relays instructions from the supervisor to other workers and gets the work pace started. Receives and resolves difficult customer complaints and requests for special services. Assists in the management of all golf course tournaments to include all aspects from beginning to end. Oversees the collection of all fees and charges and that proper cash handling procedures are followed. Maintains the pro shop merchandise by creating new displays monthly and also maintains a positive and welcoming atmosphere. Oversees the timely opening and closing of the Pro Shop to include proper activation and deactivation of the security/alarm system. Plans and organizes golf clinics for juniors golfers enrolled in the Junior Golf Program, ages 7 to 17 at varying experience and skill levels. Responsible for signing up students for the program and determining the level of instruction they will be assigned. Prior to clinics sets up the range with balls and equipment. Instructs beginner to advanced level students in all aspects of the game of golf. Specific areas of instruction include: safety, etiquette, rules, and fundamentals of the game to include putting, chipping, pitching, sand play, short irons, medium irons, long irons and woods. Supervises all student play. Monitors player progress, reevaluating instruction level as necessary by working with Junior Golf Coordinator. Performs other related duties as assigned. If interested in applying for this position you may preview the online application: https://apply.usastaffing.gov/ViewQuestionnaire/11208833

Must have the ability to reach overhead, bend, stoop and stand on hard surfaces for extended periods of time. Skillfully use hand tools or equipment needed for tasks. Must be able to work in indoor and outdoor environments. Must be able to read, write and speak English. Must be able to follow simple oral instruction, communicate effectively both orally and in writing. Must be able to understand verbal instructions in a noisy outdoor/indoor environment. An uncommon tour of duty is required. Must have a valid driver's license and the ability to safely operate a vehicle.

Details.JobSummary:
About the position:
This position will be assigned to the Special Events, Air Force Academy, Colorado. This position does not include benefits.
Details.AgencyMarketingStatement: Thank you for considering employment with Air Force Services Non-Appropriated Funds (NAF)
MajorDuties: Duties vary based on FSS special event working. Events include concerts and recreational events such as large banquets, concerts, golf tournaments or other sporting events. May take orders and sell or dispense a variety of items, to include alcoholic beverages and/or short-order items. Operates a cash register, rings up the sale, receives money and makes change. Performs various inventory functions such as replenishing material at the event. Performs light food service functions. May be required to load, deliver, and unload merchandise in a manner which prevents damage to or loss of merchandise. May work indoors and/or outdoor events. May be required to work at any of the special events on or off the Academy grounds. Must be available for concession events during the season. Performs set-up and tear down duties of special events. May be required to drive a small vehicle to procure and deliver goods to different areas on and off base. Other related duties as assigned. Washes tables and counters, vacuums and shampoos carpets. Sweeps and mops kitchen floors, cleans windows, washes walls and cleans and sanitizes trashcans. Sorts, washes, peels and cuts fresh fruits and vegetables. Performs other related duties as assigned. Details.AgencyMarketingStatement: Thank you for considering employment with Air Force Services Non-Appropriated Funds (NAF)
MajorDuties: Sets up cafeteria lines, steam tables, dining room tables, and side service stands with hot and cold food items including meats, vegetables, salads, desserts, bread, butter and beverages. Serves food in a family style or cafeteria style. Breaks down and cleans area when meals are complete. Sets up dining room tables for service, to include banquet style set-up, places food and beverages on tables, and replenishes items as necessary. Sets up and operates dishwashers, performs preventive maintenance and cleaning. Scrapes, soaks, scours and scrubs bowls, pots and pans. Also performs heavy duty cleaning tasks such as ceilings, exhaust hoods, under and behind kitchen equipment, washes floors and walls, walk-in refrigerators and freezers, sanitizes garbage cans. May unload food from delivery trucks. Collects and transfers trash from work area to disposal area. Assembles and tosses fresh fruit or green salads in quantity using prepared dressings, serves into standard serving sizes. Makes cold sandwiches using prepared ingredients. Makes coffee, tea and other beverages. Performs other related duties as assigned. Details.AgencyMarketingStatement: Thank you for considering employment with Air Force Services Non-Appropriated Funds (NAF)

Prepares convenience items such as frozen hash browns, fish fillets and chicken nuggets. Some cooks at this level prepare and bake pizza. Washes and cleans kitchen equipment. Ability to follow oral and written instructions, work safely, and do simple arithmetic. Knowledge of operating and cleaning food service equipment, characteristics of various foods, and ability to season food and decide when foods are done is required. Must be physically able to frequently lift objects the weighing up to 40 pounds. Must be able to continuously stand, walk, stoop, reach, push, pull and bend for long periods of time. Must be able to obtain a Food Handler's Certificate and/or complete food handler's training. Applicants must be 18 years of age. Applicants who are 18 may sell, dispense or serve alcoholic beverages so long as they are supervised by someone on premises who is 21 years of age or older.

About the position:
This position will be assigned to the Academy Bowling Lanes, Air Force Academy, Colorado. This position does not include benefits. Continual standing and walking, and frequent stooping, reaching, pushing, pulling, and bending. Frequently lifts or moves objects weighing up to 40 pounds unassisted, and occasionally lifts or moves objects weighing over 40 pounds with assistance.
Details.AgencyMarketingStatement: Thank you for considering employment with Air Force Services Non-Appropriated Funds (NAF)
MajorDuties: Performs a full range of simple cooking tasks by preparing and cooking items that require little or no processing such as pancakes, sausage, eggs, hamburgers and fresh or canned vegetables. Prepares hot cereals, broiled meats; prepares and cooks concentrated or dehydrated soups, sauces, and gravies; makes cold sandwich fillings. Prepares convenience items such as frozen hash browns, fish fillets and chicken nuggets. Prepares and bakes pizza. Prepares food by peeling, chopping, grinding, paring, cutting, slicing, dicing, pureeing, dredging, flouring or breading; weighs, measures and assembles ingredients for regular menu items; sets up and replenishes salad bar; portions foods for distribution and meal service, and covers, dates and stores leftovers according to established procedures. Washes and cleans kitchen equipment. Runs the register at the rental counter. Checks out shoes and other equipment. Assigns and activates bowling lanes. Performs other related duties as assigned. If interested in applying for this position you may preview the online application: https://apply.usastaffing.gov/ViewQuestionnaire/11225895

Details.JobSummary:
About the position:
This position will be assigned to the Cadet Natatorium, Air Force Academy, Colorado. This position does not include benefits. Applicant must be able to lift up to 50 pounds.
Details.AgencyMarketingStatement: Thank you for considering employment with Air Force Services Non-Appropriated Funds (NAF)
MajorDuties: Continuously observes swimming area to ensure safety of patrons. If interested in applying for this position you may preview the online application. Ensures that the swimming area is open to patrons at the scheduled times and that authorized persons only are admitted to the area. Rescues swimmers in trouble, promptly administers first aid, and calls for medical assistance if and when needed. Warns swimmers of unsafe environmental or health conditions, ocean conditions of rough water or hazards, and recommends closing swimming areas until safe conditions prevail. When working at pools may operate water pumps and control chemical additives to ensure pool water meets specific standards. Ensures that diving boards are inspected frequently for cracks or loose matting, and that necessary repairs are made. May perform other related or incidental duties as assigned for the daily operation of the swimming area to include: cleaning of bath houses, wading pools, main pools, pool decks, sunbathing areas, etc. Performs other related duties as assigned.

Details.AgencyMarketingStatement: Thank you for considering employment with Air Force Services Non-Appropriated Funds (NAF)
MajorDuties: Sets up carts with proper amount and appropriate size of spoons, forks, plates, bowls, plastic drinking glasses and serving utensils, and replenishes items as needed. Set up carts with appropriate serving portions of hot and cold food items including meats, vegetables, fruits, bread and beverages. Continually cleans and sanitize work area. Sets up and operates dishwashing sinks and dishwashers, performs preventive maintenance and cleaning of equipment. Scrapes, soaks, scours and scrubs bowls pots and pans. Also performs heavy duty cleaning task such as exhaust hoods, under and behind kitchen appliances and equipment, sweeps and mops floors, washes down walls, walk-in refrigerator and freezer, sanitizes trash cans. May rotate, label and shelve incoming supplies. Collects and transfers trash from work area to disposal area. Performs other related duties as assigned by Kitchen Manager or Supervisor. Details.JobSummary:
About the position:
This position will be assigned to the Child and Youth Center, Air Force Academy, Colorado. This position does include benefits. Work requires continual standing and walking, frequent stooping, reaching, pushing and pulling, and bending. Frequent lifting or moving of objects weighing 30 pounds and over and occasionally lifting objects weighing over 45 pounds. Applicant must be able to stand and walk for long periods of time.
Details.AgencyMarketingStatement: Thank you for considering employment with Air Force Services Non-Appropriated Funds (NAF)
MajorDuties: Prepares a variety of meals of limited complexity following USDA-approved recipes and in accordance with the needs of the various day programs offered by the Child Development Center. On a day-to-day basis, prepares breakfast items, such as oatmeal, toast, boxed cereals, pancakes, scrambled eggs and fresh fruit. Prepares a lunch meal of items such as homemade soups or stews, casseroles, chili, burritos, pizza, mashed potatoes, vegetables, fresh or canned fruits, applesauce, banana bread, cookies and occasionally desserts such as apple cobbler. Food is prepared for children of various ages. Prepared food will be of varying consistencies/textures depending on the age of children being served. Substitutions are also made to ensure special dietary needs, such as allergies, are met on a daily basis. Measures and/or weighs portions and ingredients as required by recipes. Adjusts recipes for the number of servings required in large quantity cooking. Maintains the proper temperature for all foods during holding, transport, reheating and serving to assure quality control and food safety. Places cooked foods in serving dishes, trays, and carrying carts. May be required to roll carts to children's eating areas. Washes, cleans and disinfects kitchen equipment. The kitchen has the following standard equipment: oven/grill. Refrigerator, food processor, microwave, large mixer and slicer. Dates and stores food items and monitors food spoilage on a daily basis to ensure compliance with regulations. Accurately documents the productivity records daily. As required, assists the Assistant Director in ordering supplies. Performs other related duties as assigned. If interested in applying for this position you may preview the online application: https://apply.usastaffing.gov/ViewQuestionnaire/11254787
Details.Education: Some federal jobs allow you to substitute your education for the required experience in order to qualify. This position does not allow for education substitution. FOREIGN EDUCATION: Education completed in foreign colleges or universities may be used to meet the requirements. You must show proof the education credentials have been deemed to be at least equivalent to that gained in conventional U.S. education program. It is your responsibility to provide such evidence when applying.
Details.Evaluations: Your resume and supporting document will be evaluated against the qualifications of the position. Once the announcement has closed, a review of your application package (resume, supporting documents, and responses to the questionnaire) will be used to determine whether you meet the qualification requirements listed on this announcement. If you are minimally qualified, your resume and supporting documentation will be compared against your responses to the assessment questionnaire to determine your level of experience. If, after reviewing your resume and/or supporting documentation, a determination has been made that you have inflated your responses to meet the position's qualifications and/or experience, you may lose consideration for this position. Please follow all instructions carefully when applying, errors or omissions may affect your eligibility. You should list any relevant performance appraisals and incentive awards in your resume as that information may be taken into consideration during the selection process. If selected, you may be required to provide supporting documentation. To better expedite the hiring process, we recommend including full contact information (name, address, phone number, email, etc.,) for professional and personal references on your resume.
Details.HowToApply: To be considered for this vacancy you must apply and complete the online questionnaire and submit the documentation specified in the Required Documents section above. The complete application package must be submitted by 11:59 PM (EST) on 11/04/2021 to receive consideration. To begin, click Apply to access the online application. You will need to be logged into your USAJobs account to apply. If you do not have a USAJobs account, you will need to create one before beginning the application. Follow the prompts to select your resume and/or other supporting documents to be included with your application package. You will have the opportunity to upload additional documents to include in your application before it is submitted. Your uploaded documents may take several hours to clear the virus scan process. After acknowledging you have reviewed your application package, complete the Include Personal Information section as you deem appropriate and click to continue with the application process. You will be taken to the online application which you must complete in order to apply for the position. Complete the online application, verify the required documentation is included with your application package and submit the application. You must re-select your resume and/or other documents from your USAJobs account and designate the document type when submitting your application. Failure to complete this portion will result in an incomplete application package and you will not be further considered for this vacancy. It is your responsibility to ensure your application package (resume, supporting documents, and responses to the questionnaire) is complete, accurate, and submitted by the closing date. Additional information on how to complete the online application process and submit your online application may be found on the https://help.usastaffing.gov/Apply/index.php?title=Applicant To verify or check the status of your application, log into your USAJobs account. Once logged in, the Welcome screen lists your applications, your application status and the date it was last updated. For information on what each Application Status means, visit: https://www.usajobs.gov/Help/how-to/application/status If you are unable to apply online, view the following link for information regarding Alternate Application Information (https://help.usastaffing.gov/apply/index.php?title=Alternate_Application_Information)
Details.WhatToExpectNext: If you provided an email address, you will receive an email message acknowledging receipt of your application. Times may vary during the hiring process, as your application status updates/changes you will be notified with a notification letter via email.

The below document(s) are required and MUST be submitted with your application by the closing date of this job announcement: Resume Your resume may be submitted in any format and must support identified the general or specialized experience described in this announcement.
If your resume includes a photograph or other inappropriate material or content, it will not be used to make eligibility and qualification determinations and you may not be considered for this vacancy. Other accepted documents to support a qualification and/or claimed preference/priority eligibility may include: Cover LetterDD-214/ Statement of ServiceDiploma/ GEDDisability Letter (VA)LicenseOther (1)Other (2)PCS OrdersProfessional CertificationProof of Marriage StatusResumeSeparation Notice (RIF)SF-50/ Notification of Personnel ActionTranscript As described above, your complete application includes your resume, your responses to the online questionnaire, and supporting documents which prove your claimed eligibility. NOTE: Documents submitted as part of the application package to include supplemental documents may be shared beyond the Human Resources Office. MatchedObjectDescriptor.QualificationSummary: Who May Apply: Open to everyone. Applicants will be categorized by preference(s) and/or priority consideration eligibilities. An applicant's eligibility will be determined based on eligibility claimed in the questionnaire and proof of eligibility MUST be provided with application by the closing date, 10/29/2021 Business Based Action, Military Spouse Preference, Outside Applicant Veteran, Spouse/Widow/Parent of Veteran, and Transition Hiring Preference In order to qualify, you must meet the experience requirements described below. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student; social). You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Your resume must clearly describe your relevant experience; if the position allows for qualifying based on education, your transcripts will be required as part of your application. Qualifying Experience: Applicant must have knowledge of ordering and purchasing and procurement procedures. Must have experience performing cash management duties, including operating cash registers, and making cash deposits. Applicant must have knowledge of various office and clerical duties including managing files, answering telephones and operating computers. Must have good oral and written communication skills. Good interpersonal skills are required. Ability to operate various types of automotive equipment and tools. Applicant must have the ability to resolve common arithmetical problems and make change when receiving payments from customers. Must be able to work in a fast-paced, multi­ faceted environment and maintain excellent customer service. Applicant must have basic experience in automotive maintenance (rotating tires, changing oil, changing brakes etc). Must have the ability to operate a motor vehicle in a safe manner. The incumbent is subject to random testing for drug use.

Details.JobSummary: About the position: This position will be assigned to the Auto Skills Shop, Air Force Academy, Colorado. This position does not include benefits. Must be able to list 50 pounds. Required to work an uncommon tour of duty.
Details.AgencyMarketingStatement: Thank you for considering employment with Air Force Services Non-Appropriated Funds (NAF)
MajorDuties: Performs clerical support work for orders, purchases and other procurement needs. As a Government Purchase Card (GPC) holder, orders, receives and inspects all automotive supplies including tools, equipment and parts. Verifies all prices, calls the vendors to resolve ordering discrepancies or product quality issues. Plans special events such as the car show. Provides guidance to patrons with their automotive projects. Ensure that inventory is properly stored and identified (labeled), that the car wash is stocked and in working order, and merchandise is displayed. Operates a cash register, prepares daily cash handling reports, and makes deposits, as required. Conducts a quarterly inventory of all inventory supplies. Assists with end-of-month paperwork and file maintenance. Assures that shop is kept clean and orderly. Acts as POC for hazardous waste generation/disposal. Performs a variety of office clerical duties to include managing files, answering telephones and other general clerical duties. Opens and closes the facility as required. Assists patrons as needed with their self-help automotive projects, and maintenance. Assists in the use of tools, equipment and materials to include changing brakes, rotating tires, and performing other basic automotive care. Ensures that all patrons adhere to established safety policies. Takes parts orders from patrons. Performs other related duties as assigned. Works under the supervision of the Automotive Mechanic Supervisor. If interested in applying for this position you may preview the online application: https://apply.usastaffing.gov/ViewQuestionnaire/11266246

Details.JobSummary:
About the position:
This position will be assigned to the Sports and Fitness Center, Air Force Academy, Colorado. This position does not include benefits. Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds.
Details.AgencyMarketingStatement: Thank you for considering employment with Air Force Services Non-Appropriated Funds (NAF)
MajorDuties: Continuously observes swimming area to ensure safety of patrons. Ensures that the swimming area is open to patrons at the scheduled times and that authorized persons only are admitted to the area. Collects, safeguards, and deposit fees received from customers. Enforces pool rules with customers. Rescues swimmers in trouble, promptly administers first aid, CPR, and calls for medical assistance when and if needed. Warns swimmers of unsafe environmental or health conditions, inclement weather conditions, and closes pool until safe conditions prevail. May operate water pumps and control chemical additives to ensure pool water meets specific standards. Ensures entire facility is inspected for safety and necessary repairs are reported and completed. May perform other related or incidental duties as assigned for the daily operation of the swimming area to include: restocking rest rooms, cleaning of bath houses, wading pools, main pools, pool decks, sunbathing areas, etc. Performs other related duties as assigned. If interested in applying for this position you may preview the online application: https://apply.usastaffing.gov/ViewQuestionnaire/11265237

You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Your resume must clearly describe your relevant experience; if the position allows for qualifying based on education, your transcripts will be required as part of your application. Qualifying Experience: Experience in clerical or other office work of any kind that demonstrated the ability to perform the duties of the position. Practical knowledge of recreational activities, rules and procedures and equipment. Ability to resolve common math problems and make change when receiving payments from customers. Skill and use in maintenance of various recreational facilities and equipment is desirable. Must be able to communicate both orally and in writing. Requires daily physical exertion and requires an above average physical dexterity and ability in a variety of sports activities in order to demonstrate and teach participants. Must be able to successfully pass the Fitness Fundamentals class at the first available opportunity. May be subject to an uncommon tour of duty.

Details.JobSummary:
About the position:
This position will be assigned to the Fitness and Sports Center, Air Force Academy, Colorado. This position does not include benefits. Must be able to lift and carry items up to 50 pounds. Satisfactory completion of a pre-employment physical is required. Duties are performed inside and outside with exposure to excessive heat, cold, dampness or chilling, and humidity.
Details.AgencyMarketingStatement: Thank you for considering employment with Air Force Services Non-Appropriated Funds (NAF)
MajorDuties: Performs general operational duties in support of the Fitness and Sports Center. Typical duties include but are not limited to the following: Operating a front desk operation; ensures only authorized patrons use the facility and equipment; maintains reservations system for sports courts and fields; issues and receives equipment; maintains indoor facility to include annotating hourly head counts and reporting all safety infractions and potential mishaps; ensures check-out items are clean and in good repair; inventories, restocks and displays check-out times; provides equipment manager with a list of re-order needs. Operates a point of sales system; performs receiving and disbursing cashier duties; accepts payments and makes change; may prepare and issue change funds, bank deposits and daily reports. Properly safeguards funds; ensures reserved areas are ready for use by customers; ensures lockers are clean and operable. Accounts for towels and uniforms received from the contractor. Cleans locker rooms and equipment as needed, returns weight equipment and accessories to proper racks and locations, and addresses policy violations when observed. Washes and dries towels and uniforms as needed. Assists in setting up facilities, grounds and equipment for programs and special functions and performs minor maintenance or repairs on equipment as needed. Provides assistance to facility users by explaining function and features available. Performs other duties as assigned. If interested in applying for this position you may preview the online application: https://apply.usastaffing.gov/ViewQuestionnaire/11267975

MatchedObjectDescriptor.QualificationSummary: Who May Apply: Open to everyone. Applicants will be categorized by preference(s) and/or priority consideration eligibilities. An applicant's eligibility will be determined based on eligibility claimed in the questionnaire and proof of eligibility MUST be provided with application by the closing date, 11/02/2021 Business Based Action, Military Spouse Preference, Outside Applicant Veteran, Spouse/Widow/Parent of Veteran, and Transition Hiring Preference In order to qualify, you must meet the experience requirements described below. Progressively responsible experience in clerical duties in the receipt, disbursement, examination, deposit, custody, or other processing of cash items when this includes (1) direct handling of cash items and, (2) use of cash accountability control methods. Must have computer experience to perform basic computer operations. Experience making reservations is preferred. Experience leading others in a recreational environment or similar activity is preferred. Applicant must have good organizational skills. Must have the ability to interpret and apply rules, regulations, and policies. Must have the ability to operate a motor vehicle in a safe manner. The incumbent is subject to random testing for drug use. Must be able to lift items weighing up to 50 pounds.

Details.JobSummary:
About the position:
This position will be assigned to the Equestrian Center, Air Force Academy, Colorado. This position does not include benefits.
Details.AgencyMarketingStatement: Thank you for considering employment with Air Force Services Non-Appropriated Funds (NAF)
MajorDuties: Assists in planning and scheduling recreation programs and special events for USAFA Equestrian Center. Drives vehicle to various sites. During the absence of a manager, resolves customer complaints and other day-to-day operational issues and elevates unresolved employee complaints to supervisor. Responsible for leading the work of staff assigned to USAF Equestrian Center, when management is unavailable to include distributing and balancing workload among employees. While leading, observes work in progress, production, and adherence to quality and safety standards. Instructs and trains new employees. Rings up sales in register and follows proper cash handling procedures. Prepares daily cash reports and deposit bag/slip. Prepares reports and other statistical and financial data pertaining to the stables for items such as grain, hay, number of horses rented, etc. Assists in ordering, purchasing and receiving supplies and inventory items. Responsible for leading the work of staff assigned to USAFA Equestrian Center, when management is unavailable. Distributes and balances workload among employees. Observes work in progress, production, and adherence to quality and safety standards. Instructs and trains new employees. Curries and brushes horses; combs mane and tail; cleans hoofs. Saddles horses for riders. Maintains equipment, e.g., saddles, bridles, etc., and makes minor repairs to fences and facility. Feeds, waters, and exercises horses. Grains and turns horses into the corral area. Cleans stables area; cleans water tanks in full care, partial care and pasture areas. Observes horses for obvious changes in behavior, appearance, and activity; informs supervisor if necessary. May accompany or guide various recreational trips when necessary. Manages volunteer program. Performs other related duties as assigned If interested in applying for this position you may preview the online application: https://apply.usastaffing.gov/ViewQuestionnaire/11272214
Details.Education: Some federal jobs allow you to substitute your education for the required experience in order to qualify. This position Does not allow for education substitution. FOREIGN EDUCATION: Education completed in foreign colleges or universities may be used to meet the requirements. You must show proof the education credentials have been deemed to be at least equivalent to that gained in conventional U.S. education program. It is your responsibility to provide such evidence when applying.
Details.Evaluations: Your resume and supporting document will be evaluated against the qualifications of the position. Once the announcement has closed, a review of your application package (resume, supporting documents, and responses to the questionnaire) will be used to determine whether you meet the qualification requirements listed on this announcement. If you are minimally qualified, your resume and supporting documentation will be compared against your responses to the assessment questionnaire to determine your level of experience. If, after reviewing your resume and/or supporting documentation, a determination has been made that you have inflated your responses to meet the position's qualifications and/or experience, you may lose consideration for this position. Please follow all instructions carefully when applying, errors or omissions may affect your eligibility. You should list any relevant performance appraisals and incentive awards in your resume as that information may be taken into consideration during the selection process. If selected, you may be required to provide supporting documentation. To better expedite the hiring process, we recommend including full contact information (name, address, phone number, email, etc.,) for professional and personal references on your resume.
Details.HowToApply: To be considered for this vacancy you must apply and complete the online questionnaire and submit the documentation specified in the Required Documents section above. The complete application package must be submitted by 11:59 PM (EST) on 11/02/2021 to receive consideration. To begin, click Apply to access the online application. You will need to be logged into your USAJobs account to apply. If you do not have a USAJobs account, you will need to create one before beginning the application. Follow the prompts to select your resume and/or other supporting documents to be included with your application package. You will have the opportunity to upload additional documents to include in your application before it is submitted. Your uploaded documents may take several hours to clear the virus scan process. After acknowledging you have reviewed your application package, complete the Include Personal Information section as you deem appropriate and click to continue with the application process. You will be taken to the online application which you must complete in order to apply for the position. Complete the online application, verify the required documentation is included with your application package and submit the application. You must re-select your resume and/or other documents from your USAJobs account and designate the document type when submitting your application. Failure to complete this portion will result in an incomplete application package and you will not be further considered for this vacancy. It is your responsibility to ensure your application package (resume, supporting documents, and responses to the questionnaire) is complete, accurate, and submitted by the closing date. Additional information on how to complete the online application process and submit your online application may be found on the https://help.usastaffing.gov/Apply/index.php?title=Applicant To verify or check the status of your application, log into your USAJobs account. Once logged in, the Welcome screen lists your applications, your application status and the date it was last updated. For information on what each Application Status means, visit: https://www.usajobs.gov/Help/how-to/application/status If you are unable to apply online, view the following link for information regarding Alternate Application Information (https://help.usastaffing.gov/apply/index.php?title=Alternate_Application_Information)
